column4: Hi, my sound in ubuntu has a lot of static. What could cause this?
bad grounding?
it worked fine in windows, this is a fresh install of ubuntu
when does the static occur?
when any sound plays. all i hear is static and a hint of what should be playing
in terminal, type "alsamixer" and try bringing the PCM volume down until the static goes away and bring the  master up
tried that. i still get static when PCM is at 2. Also, master volume doesn't change the sound volume at all for me
94% master and 2% master has the same volume
id play around in alsamixer .. baybe turn the bass down?
maybe
it's possible it co uld be because i have 2 sounds cards (onboard and pci), but i have the pci one set to my default card
perhaps... maybe disable the onboard card in the bios? Though that really shouldnt be the case
I have a bit of trouble with static as well in linux when the volume gets high on any audio output
what has me confused is no matter what i do with the master volume setting.. the volume stays the same
thats pribably because PCM is way down
probably
yeah i played around with PCM, and it has no effect on volume either
Well, if i turn PCM to 0.. there is no volume. that's about it
ok i gots to sleep :/
but if i set master volume to 0, i still have sound.. lol
arent there other settings to play with in alsamixer?
